reasoning: Umbrella term covering benign adenomas, adrenocortical carcinoma (0.05-0.2 per 100k), pheochromocytomas (0.2-0.8 per 100k), and other adrenal neoplasms. Aggregate estimate of ~1.5 per 100k for clinically diagnosed cases. Confidence reduced due to heterogeneity and varying clinical significance of lesions (many benign adenomas are asymptomatic incidentalomas).
source: Aggregate estimate based on subtypes: adrenocortical carcinoma, pheochromocytoma, benign functional adenomas
